text: Parashorea lucida (also called white meranti) is a species of plant in the family Dipterocarpaceae. The name lucida is derived from Latin (lucidus = clear) and refers to the venation on the leaf. It is a tall emergent tree, up to 60 m tall, found in mixed dipterocarp forest on clay and clay soils. It is found in Sumatra and Borneo. It is threatened by habitat loss. ==References== lucida Category:Critically endangered plants Category:Trees of Sumatra Category:Trees of Borneo Category:Flora of Sarawak Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Parashorea lucida
